title: Paths of Glory
summary: When soldiers in World War I refuse to continue with an impossible attack, their superior officers decide to make an example of them.

title: Jibon Thekey Neya
summary: A political satire of Bangladesh under the rule of Pakistan metaphorically, where an autocratic woman in one family symbolizes the political dictatorship of Ayub Khan in East Pakistan.

title: Command Decision
summary: Army generals struggle with the decision to prioritize bombing the German factories producing new jet fighters over the extremely high casualties the mission will cost.

title: My Friend Rashed (Amar Bondhu Rashed)
summary: Amar Bondhu Rashed, a fictional story based on the Liberation War of Bangladesh and written by the popular children's literature Dr Mohammad Jafar Iqbal

title: Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose: The Forgotten Hero
summary: The film, which is about the last five years of the Indian leader Subhas Chandra Bose's life, also includes his life's story in flashback sequences. However, it does not cover the controversy surrounding Bose's death.

title: So Little Time
summary: During World War II, German soldiers occupy the home of a beautiful Belgian girl and her mother.

title: The Boys
summary: A group of mischievous Finnish boys experience the ups and downs of life during World War 2.

summary: A dramatization of the World War II Battle of Iwo Jima.

title: City of War: The Story of John Rabe
summary: A true-story account of a German businessman who saved more than 200,000 Chinese during the Nanjing massacre in 1937-38.
